concept.title: SGSN support for Rel-8 testing enhancements - phase 2 (Feature f52081-03)
concept.shortdesc: This feature enhances the SGSN Rel-8 legacy testing scope.

conbody.p: Whenever the SGSN needs to select the S-GW after a Rel-8 DNS query, the selected S-GW needs to support either S4 and S5 services/interfaces for the case of homer/LBO or S4 and S8 services/interfaces for the case of a roamer. Then it resolves the S4 service to send the Create Session Request message to. This logic is applied as basic Rel-8 functionality.
The services are obtainable from the response to the NAPTR query in the form of services which are named as:
Within the answers contained at the S-GW NAPTR response, the SGSN selects those S-GWs that support:
both the S4 and S5 or the S4 and S8 (depending on the case) services within the same NAPTR answer.
both the S4 and S5 or the S4 and S8 (depending on the case) services in different NAPTR answers but with the same canonical name.

A UTPFIL parameter is also introduced in order to keep the old functionality so as to address temporarily possible compatibility problems. The permanent solution is to update the DNS service so as to include appropriate S4 service (x-3gpp-sgw:x-s4) at the DNS responses. The default value of UTPFIL is to deactivate the old functionality. In case that a valid S-GW cannot be found, the fallback to Rel-7 functionality occurs by default.
